gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਕੋਪੀਯੰ ਕਾਂਗੜੇਸੰ ਕਟੋਚੰ || ਮੁਖੰ ਕਰਤ ਨੈਨੰ ਤਜੇ ਸਰਬ ਸੋਚੰ ||
transliteration: Tabai Kopooyan Kaandesan Katicgadg|| Moukhanndrakat Nainan Taje Sarab Sochannd||
translation: Then the Raja of Kangra (Kirpal Chand Katoch) was filled with anger. His face and eyes became red with rage and he freed himself from all other thoughts.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤੇ ੳੁੱਠੀਯੰ ਖਾਨ ਖੇਤੰ ਖਤੰਗੰ || ਮਨੋ ਬਿਹਚਰੈ ਮਾਸ ਹੇਤੰ ਪਿਲੰਗੰ ||੨੬||
transliteration: Oute Outthooyan Khaan Khetan Khatanadg|| Mano Bihcdarai Maas Hetan Pilanadg||26||
translation: From another side, the Khans entered with arrows in their hands. It seemed that the leopards were roaming in search of flesh.26.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੀ ਭੇਰ ਭੁੰਕਾਰ ਤੀਰੰ ਤੜੱਕੇ || ਮਿਲੇ ਹੱਥਿ ਬੱਖੰ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਣੰ ਕੜੱਕੇ ||
transliteration: Badoo Jan Noosaan Katthe Kathooran|| Phirai Round Mounndan Kridaanan Kadakke||
translation: The kettledrums, the arrows and swords in action create their particular sounds, the hands move towards the wounded waist.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੇ ਜੰਗ ਨੀਸਣ ਕੱਥੇ ਕਥੀਰੰ || ਫਿਰੈ ਰੁੰਡ ਮੁੰਡੰ ਤਨੰ ਤੱਛ ਤੀਰੰ ||੨੭||
transliteration: Bade Jan Noosan Katthe Kathooran|| Phirai Round Mounndan Tanan Tachchh Tooran||27||
translation: The trumpets resound in the field and the minstrels sing their heroic ballads, the bodies are pierced by arrows and the headless trunks are moving in the field. 27

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੈ ਟੋਪ ਟੂਕੰ ਗੁਰਜੈ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੇ || ਰੁਲੇ ਲੁੱਥ ਜੁੱਥੰ ਗਿਰੇ ਬੀਰ ਮਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Outhai Top Tookan Gurjai Prahaade|| Rule Loutth Joutthan Gire Boor Mdare||
translation: The blows of maces on helmets create knocking sounds, the bodies of killed warriors are rolling in dust.

gurmukhi: ਪਰੈ ਕੱਤੀਯੰ ਘਾਤ ਨਿਰਘਾਤ ਬੀਰੰ || ਫਿਰੈ ਰੁੰਡ ਮੁੰਡੰ ਤਨੰ ਤੱਛ ਤੀਰੰ ||੨੮||
transliteration: Darai Kattoohan Nirghaat Booran|| Phirai Round Mounndan Tanan Tachchh Tooran||28||
translation: The swords are inflicting wounds on the bodies of heroes; the bodies pierced by arrows and headless trunks are moving in the field.28.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੀ ਬਾਹੁ ਅਾਘਾਤ ਨਿਰਘਾਤ ਬਾਣੰ || ੳੁਠੇ ਨੱਦ ਨਾਦੰ ਕੜੱਕੇ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਣੰ ||
transliteration: Badoo Baah(u) Aaghaat Nirghaat Baanan|| Outhe Nadd Naadan Kadakke Kridaanan||
translation: The arms are engaged in continuously shooting arrows, the striking swords are creating grave clatrtering sounds.

gurmukhi: ਛਕੇ ਛੋਭ ਛਤ੍ਰੀ ਤਜੈ ਬਾਣ ਰਾਜੀ || ਬਹੇ ਜਾਹਿ ਖਾਲੀ ਫਿਰੈ ਛੂਛ ਤਾਜੀ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Chhake Chhodhh Chhatroo Tajai Baan Raajoo|| Bade Jaah(i) Dhaaloo Phirai Chhodhchh Taajoo||29||
translation: The warriors, in great fury, are showering volleys of arrows; some arrows miss the targets and on account of some arrows, the horses are seen roaming without the riders.29.

gurmukhi: ਜੁਟੇ ਅਾਪ ਮੈ ਬੀਰ ਬੀਰੰ ਜੁਝਾਰੇ || ਮਨੋ ਗੱਜ ਜੁੱਟੇ ਦੰਤਾਰੇ ਦੰਤਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Joute Aap Mai Boor Booran Jujhdare|| Mano Gadj Joutte Dantdare Dantdare||
translation: The brave warriors fighting with each other appear like the elephants with tusks fighting mutually,

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੋ ਸਿੰਘ ਸੋ ਸਾਰਦੂਲੰ ਅਰੁੱਝੇ || ਤਿਸੀ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਕਿਰਪਾਲ ਗੋਪਾਲ ਜੁੱਝੇ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Kidho Singh So Saardoolan Arujjhe|| Tisoo Bhaant(i) Kirpaal Gopaal Jujjhe||30||
translation: Or the tiger confronting the tiger. In a similar manner, Gopal Chand Guleria is fighting with Kirpal Chand (the ally of Hussaini).30.

gurmukhi: ਹਰੀ ਸਿੰਘ ਧਾਯੋ ਤਹਾਂ ੲੇਕ ਬੀਰੰ || ਸਹੇ ਦੇਹ ਅਾਪੰ ਭਲੀ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਤੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Daroo Singh Dhaayo Tahaan Ek Booran|| Sahe Deh Aapan Bhaloo Bhaant(i) Tooran||
translation: Then another warrior Hari Singh rushed into the field; he received many arrows in his body.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਕੋਪ ਕੈ ਬੀਰ ਬ੍ਰਿੰਦੰ ਸੰਘਾਰੇ || ਬਡੋ ਜੁਧ ਕੈ ਦੇਵ ਲੋਕੰ ਪਧਾਰੇ ||੩੧||
transliteration: Mahaan Kop Kai Boor Brindan Sanhdare|| Bado Judh Kai Dev Lokan Padhdare||31||
translation: In great rage, he killed many soldiers and after a great fight departed for the heavenly abode.31.

gurmukhi: ਹਠਿਯੋ ਹਿੰਮਤੰ ਕਿੰਮਤੰ ਲੈ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਨੰ || ਲੲੇ ਗੁਰਜ ਚੱਲੰ ਸੁ ਜਲਾਲਖਾਨੰ ||
transliteration: Hathiyo Hinmatan Kinmatan Lai Kridaanan|| Lae Gurj Challan Su Jalaakhaanan||
translation: The tenacious Himmat and Kimmat drew out their spears and Jalal Khan joined with a mace.

gurmukhi: ਹਠੇ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਮੱਤ ਜੋਧਾ ਜੁਝਾਰੰ || ਪਰੀ ਕੁੱਟ ੳੁਠੀ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਝਾਰੰ ||੩੨||
transliteration: Hathe Soormaa Matt Jodhaa Jujhaaran|| Daroo Koutt Kouttan Outhoo Sastra Jhaaran||32||
translation: The determined warriors fought, seemingly intoxicated. There were blows after blows and the sparks fell, when the weapons struck each other.32.
